definitions.definition: To obtain (something) in exchange for money or goods.
examples: Who'd Father buy the car for? He bought it for me, not for you.

definitions.definition: To obtain, especially by some sacrifice.
examples: I've bought material comfort by foregoing my dreams.
You just bought yourself an assault charge!

definitions.definition: To suffer consequences for (something) through being deprived of something; to pay for (something one has done).

examples: He tried to buy me with gifts, but I wouldn't give up my beliefs.

definitions.definition: To be equivalent to in value.
examples: The dollar doesn't buy as much as it used to.

definitions.definition: to accept as true; to believe
examples: I'm not going to buy your stupid excuses anymore!

definitions.definition: To make a purchase or purchases, to treat (for a drink, meal or gift)
examples: Let's go out for dinner. I'm buying .

definitions.definition: To make a bluff , usually a large one.
examples: Smith tried to buy the pot on the river with a huge bluff.

main_definition: ( transitive , ditransitive ) To obtain (something) in exchange for money or goods.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , ditransitive ) To obtain, especially by some sacrifice.
( transitive , archaic ) To suffer consequences for (something) through being deprived of something; to pay for (something one has done).
( transitive ) To be equivalent to in value.
( transitive , informal ) to accept as true; to believe
( intransitive ) To make a purchase or purchases, to treat (for a drink, meal or gift)
( poker slang , transitive ) To make a bluff , usually a large one.
